00020 #ifndef _XENO_NUCLEUS_THREAD_H
00021 #define _XENO_NUCLEUS_THREAD_H

00032 /* Status flags */
00033 
00034 #define XNSUSP    0x00000001 
00035 #define XNPEND    0x00000002 
00036 #define XNDELAY   0x00000004 
00037 #define XNREADY   0x00000008 
00038 #define XNDORMANT 0x00000010 
00039 #define XNZOMBIE  0x00000020 
00040 #define XNRESTART 0x00000040 
00041 #define XNSTARTED 0x00000080 
00042 #define XNRELAX   0x00000100 
00043 #define XNHELD    0x00000200 
00045 #define XNTIMEO   0x00000400 
00046 #define XNRMID    0x00000800 
00047 #define XNBREAK   0x00001000 
00048 #define XNKICKED  0x00002000 
00049 #define XNBOOST   0x00004000 
00050 #define XNDEBUG   0x00008000 
00052 /* Mode flags. */
00053 #define XNLOCK    0x00010000 
00054 #define XNRRB     0x00020000 
00055 #define XNASDI    0x00040000 
00056 #define XNSHIELD  0x00080000 
00057 #define XNTRAPSW  0x00100000 
00058 #define XNRPIOFF  0x00200000 
00060 #define XNFPU     0x00400000 
00061 #define XNSHADOW  0x00800000 
00062 #define XNROOT    0x01000000 
00063 #define XNINVPS   0x02000000 
00064 #define XNWAKEN   0x04000000    /* Thread waken up upon resource availability */
00065 #define XNROBBED  0x08000000    /* Robbed from resource ownership */
00066  /* Ends doxygen comment group: nucleus_status_modes */
00068 
00069 /*
00070   Must follow the declaration order of the above bits. Status symbols
00071   are defined as follows:
00072   'S' -> Forcibly suspended.
00073   'w'/'W' -> Waiting for a resource, with or without timeout.
00074   'D' -> Delayed (without any other wait condition).
00075   'R' -> Runnable.
00076   'U' -> Unstarted or dormant.
00077   'X' -> Relaxed shadow.
00078   'H' -> Held thread.
00079   'b' -> Priority boost undergoing.
00080   'T' -> Ptraced and stopped.
00081   'l' -> Locks scheduler.
00082   'r' -> Undergoes round-robin .
00083   's' -> Interrupt shield enabled.
00084   't' -> Mode switches trapped.
00085   'o' -> Priority coupling off.
00086   'f' -> FPU enabled (for kernel threads).
00087 */
00088 #define XNTHREAD_SLABEL_INIT  {         \
00089         'S', 'W', 'D', 'R', 'U',        \
00090         '.', '.', '.', 'X', 'H',        \
00091         '.', '.', '.', '.', 'b', 'T',   \
00092         'l', 'r', '.', 's', 't', 'o',   \
00093         'f', '.', '.', '.', '.', '.'    \
00094 }
00095 
00096 #define XNTHREAD_BLOCK_BITS   (XNSUSP|XNPEND|XNDELAY|XNDORMANT|XNRELAX|XNHELD)
00097 #define XNTHREAD_MODE_BITS    (XNLOCK|XNRRB|XNASDI|XNSHIELD|XNTRAPSW|XNRPIOFF)
00098 
00099 /* These flags are available to the real-time interfaces */
00100 #define XNTHREAD_SPARE0  0x10000000
00101 #define XNTHREAD_SPARE1  0x20000000
00102 #define XNTHREAD_SPARE2  0x40000000
00103 #define XNTHREAD_SPARE3  0x80000000
00104 #define XNTHREAD_SPARES  0xf0000000
00105 
00106 #if defined(__KERNEL__) || defined(__XENO_SIM__)
00107 
00108 #ifdef __XENO_SIM__
00109 /* Pseudo-status (must not conflict with other bits) */
00110 #define XNRUNNING  XNTHREAD_SPARE0
00111 #define XNDELETED  XNTHREAD_SPARE1
00112 #endif /* __XENO_SIM__ */

00114 #define XNTHREAD_INVALID_ASR  ((void (*)(xnsigmask_t))0)

00116 struct xnsched;
00117 struct xnsynch;

00119 typedef void (*xnasr_t)(xnsigmask_t sigs);

00121 typedef struct xnthread {
00122 
00123     xnarchtcb_t tcb;            /* Architecture-dependent block -- Must be first */
00124 
00125     xnflags_t status;           /* Thread status flags */
00126 
00127     struct xnsched *sched;      /* Thread scheduler */
00128 
00129     xnarch_cpumask_t affinity;  /* Processor affinity. */
00130 
00131     int bprio;                  /* Base priority (before PIP boost) */
00132 
00133     int cprio;                  /* Current priority */
00134 
00135     xnpholder_t rlink;          /* Thread holder in ready queue */
00136 
00137     xnpholder_t plink;          /* Thread holder in synchronization queue(s) */
00138 
00139     xnholder_t glink;           /* Thread holder in global queue */
00140 
00141 /* We don't want side-effects on laddr here! */
00142 #define link2thread(laddr,link) \
00143 ((xnthread_t *)(((char *)laddr) - (int)(&((xnthread_t *)0)->link)))
00144 
00145     xnpqueue_t claimq;          /* Owned resources claimed by others (PIP) */
00146 
00147     struct xnsynch *wchan;      /* Resource the thread pends on */
00148 
00149     xntimer_t rtimer;           /* Resource timer */
00150 
00151     xntimer_t ptimer;           /* Periodic timer */
00152 
00153     xnticks_t pexpect;          /* Date of next periodic release point (raw ticks). */
00154 
00155     xnsigmask_t signals;        /* Pending core signals */
00156 
00157     xnticks_t rrperiod;         /* Allotted round-robin period (ticks) */
00158 
00159     xnticks_t rrcredit;         /* Remaining round-robin time credit (ticks) */
00160 
00161 #ifdef CONFIG_XENO_OPT_STATS
00162     struct {
00163         unsigned long ssw;      /* Primary -> secondary mode switch count */
00164         unsigned long csw;      /* Context switches (includes
00165                                    secondary -> primary switches) */
00166         unsigned long pf;       /* Number of page faults */
00167        xnticks_t exec_time;    /* Accumulated execution time (tsc) */
00168        xnticks_t exec_start;   /* Start of execution time accumulation (tsc) */
00169     } stat;
00170 #endif /* CONFIG_XENO_OPT_STATS */
00171 
00172     int errcode;                /* Local errno */
00173 
00174     xnasr_t asr;                /* Asynchronous service routine */
00175 
00176     xnflags_t asrmode;          /* Thread's mode for ASR */
00177 
00178     int asrimask;               /* Thread's interrupt mask for ASR */
00179 
00180     unsigned asrlevel;          /* ASR execution level (ASRs are reentrant) */
00181 
00182     int imask;                  /* Initial interrupt mask */
00183 
00184     int imode;                  /* Initial mode */
00185 
00186     int iprio;                  /* Initial priority */
00187 
00188 #ifdef CONFIG_XENO_OPT_REGISTRY
00189     struct {
00190         xnhandle_t handle;      /* Handle in registry */
00191         const char *waitkey;    /* Pended key */
00192     } registry;
00193 #endif /* CONFIG_XENO_OPT_REGISTRY */
00194 
00195     unsigned magic;             /* Skin magic. */
00196 
00197     char name[XNOBJECT_NAME_LEN]; /* Symbolic name of thread */
00198 
00199     xnticks_t stime;            /* Start time */
00200 
00201     void (*entry)(void *cookie); /* Thread entry routine */
00202 
00203     void *cookie;               /* Cookie to pass to the entry routine */
00204 
00205     XNARCH_DECL_DISPLAY_CONTEXT();
00206 
00207 } xnthread_t;

00209 #define XNHOOK_THREAD_START  1
00210 #define XNHOOK_THREAD_SWITCH 2
00211 #define XNHOOK_THREAD_DELETE 3

00213 typedef struct xnhook {
00214 
00215     xnholder_t link;
00216 
00217 #define link2hook(laddr) \
00218 ((xnhook_t *)(((char *)laddr) - (int)(&((xnhook_t *)0)->link)))
00219 
00220     void (*routine)(xnthread_t *thread);
00221 
00222 } xnhook_t;

00224 #define xnthread_name(thread)              ((thread)->name)
00225 #define xnthread_clear_name(thread)        do { *(thread)->name = 0; } while(0)
00226 #define xnthread_sched(thread)             ((thread)->sched)
00227 #define xnthread_start_time(thread)        ((thread)->stime)
00228 #define xnthread_status_flags(thread)      ((thread)->status)
00229 #define xnthread_test_flags(thread,flags)  testbits((thread)->status,flags)
00230 #define xnthread_set_flags(thread,flags)   __setbits((thread)->status,flags)
00231 #define xnthread_clear_flags(thread,flags) __clrbits((thread)->status,flags)
00232 #define xnthread_initial_priority(thread)  ((thread)->iprio)
00233 #define xnthread_base_priority(thread)     ((thread)->bprio)
00234 #define xnthread_current_priority(thread)  ((thread)->cprio)
00235 #define xnthread_time_slice(thread)        ((thread)->rrperiod)
00236 #define xnthread_time_credit(thread)       ((thread)->rrcredit)
00237 #define xnthread_archtcb(thread)           (&((thread)->tcb))
00238 #define xnthread_asr_level(thread)         ((thread)->asrlevel)
00239 #define xnthread_pending_signals(thread)   ((thread)->signals)
00240 #define xnthread_timeout(thread)           xntimer_get_timeout(&(thread)->rtimer)
00241 #define xnthread_stack_size(thread)        xnarch_stack_size(xnthread_archtcb(thread))
00242 #define xnthread_handle(thread)            ((thread)->registry.handle)
00243 #define xnthread_set_magic(thread,m)       do { (thread)->magic = (m); } while(0)
00244 #define xnthread_get_magic(thread)         ((thread)->magic)
00245 #define xnthread_signaled_p(thread)        ((thread)->signals != 0)
00246 #define xnthread_user_task(thread)         xnarch_user_task(xnthread_archtcb(thread))
00247 #define xnthread_user_pid(thread) \
00248     (testbits((thread)->status,XNROOT) || !xnthread_user_task(thread) ? \
00249     0 : xnarch_user_pid(xnthread_archtcb(thread)))
00250 
00251 #ifdef CONFIG_XENO_OPT_STATS
00252 #define xnthread_inc_ssw(thread)     ++(thread)->stat.ssw
00253 #define xnthread_inc_csw(thread)     ++(thread)->stat.csw
00254 #define xnthread_inc_pf(thread)      ++(thread)->stat.pf
00255 #else /* CONFIG_XENO_OPT_STATS */
00256 #define xnthread_inc_ssw(thread)     do { } while(0)
00257 #define xnthread_inc_csw(thread)     do { } while(0)
00258 #define xnthread_inc_pf(thread)      do { } while(0)
00259 #endif /* CONFIG_XENO_OPT_STATS */

00268                   xnflags_t flags,

00271 void xnthread_cleanup_tcb(xnthread_t *thread);

00275 int *xnthread_get_errno_location(void);
00276 
00277 static inline xnticks_t xnthread_get_timeout(xnthread_t *thread, xnticks_t now)
00278 {
00279     xnticks_t timeout;
00280 
00281     if (!testbits(thread->status,XNDELAY))
00282         return 0LL;
00283 
00284     timeout = (xntimer_get_date(&thread->rtimer) ? : xntimer_get_date(&thread->ptimer));
00285 
00286     if (timeout <= now)
00287         return 1;
00288 
00289     return timeout - now;
00290 }
00291 
00292 static inline xnticks_t xnthread_get_period(xnthread_t *thread)
00293 {
00294     xnticks_t period = 0;
00295 
00296     /*
00297      * The current thread period might be:
00298      * - the value of the timer interval for periodic threads (ns/ticks)
00299      * - or, the value of the alloted round-robin quantum (ticks)
00300      * - or zero, meaning "no periodic activity".
00301      */
00302        
00303     if (xntimer_running_p(&thread->ptimer))
00304         period = xntimer_get_interval(&thread->ptimer);
00305     else if (xnthread_test_flags(thread,XNRRB))
00306         period = xnthread_time_slice(thread);
00307 
00308     return period;
00309 }
00310 
00311 #ifdef __cplusplus
00312 }
00313 #endif

00315 #endif /* __KERNEL__ || __XENO_SIM__ */
